item.description:
Ah, Noh Theater! Posted on behalf of Yutaka Tanno, this is yet another fantastic FREE event open to the general public. As with most of these events, please try to arrive a bit early so as to secure yourself a good seat.

Date: Friday, April 20, 2007

Time: 5:30 pm - 7:00 pm

Location: MIT / W20-201Â (Building W20, Room 201)

Map: http://whereis.mit.ed...

Speakers: Mr. Kanji Shimizu, Mr. Takao Nishimura, and Mr. Kenichi Kasai

This workshop will teach you all about the Japanese traditional theater act, Noh. We invited the top-class Noh actors and the producer who will be in the Noh performance to be hosted by MIT Japan Program this November. The guests include two actors from Kanze-Ryu, Mr. Kanji Shimizu and Mr. Takao Nishimura (both appointed as intangible cultural properties by Japanese govermenet), the producer Mr. Kenichi Kasai, and more. In the workshop, they will show you the exotic masks, clothing, and instruments to be used in the performance, and they will also play the instruments. This is really a rare opportunity to learn about Noh directly from the top performers. We are honored and thrilled to host this event, and look forward to seeing you there.

Open to the general public

Cost: Free

Sponsor(s): Japanese Association of MIT (JAM)
item.name: Noh (Japanese Traditional Theater) Workshop
